result.execSummary:
The defendant Frederick Wayne Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 12-26-17 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.
Consecutive to: Any sentence; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frederick Wayne Walker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF RIGHT TO SEEK POSTCONVICTION RELIEF, PRETRIAL INCARCERATION CREDIT AND UNDATED LETTER TO THE DRUG PROGRAM, FILED

Defendant Frederick Wayne Walker in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Theft-Movable Property, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a), a class A Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve SEVENTY-FOUR (74) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for SEVENTY-FOUR (74) DAYS served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 12-26-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Court orders a $1,000.00 PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint for transport.

Defendant Frederick Wayne Walker in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Frederick Wayne Walker in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 4/1/2015 at 1:30pm.  lms
(4/16/2015 court date in br 20 is cancelled)

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Frederick Wayne Walker not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date; attempting to get defendant into Drug Treatment Court. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Frederick Wayne Walker not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another date; counsel is attempting to see if Drug Treatment Court would accept Mr. Walker.  Counsel notified that if defendant is not accepted to that court and wishes to resolve this case on the next date to notify both the State and this court, so he can be produced.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frederick Wayne Walker in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Frederick Wayne Walker in custody.  Ron Dague for Kimberly Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Department Detective Britt Kohnert.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20 for scheduling conference and bail motion.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: PETER M.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Frederick Wayne Walker in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Frederick Wayne Walker in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
